Hero gear is one of the most impactful investments in Kingshot. It shapes your account progression, demands rare resources, and mistakes can be costly to correct.

This optimizer aims to push the boundaries of hero gear strategy and help you make smarter investment decisions backed by math, not guesswork. Our algorithm analyzes all 12 gear pieces across your top 3 heroes and calculates the **optimal upgrade path** based on your available resources.
Whether you're a free-to-play player maximizing every XP part or planning your red gear progression, the optimizer finds the best solution for your specific situation.
*Built by Kingshot players, for Kingshot players.*
*Covered in more depth in our video guide above.*

Hero gear is one of the most important investment topics in Kingshot. It has a massive impact on your account progression, requires rare resources to develop, and can be costly to respec if you get it wrong.
The goal of the optimizer website is to push the boundaries of thinking as it relates to Kingshot Hero gear and attempt to set a new standard in optimizing your hero gear investments. No small task.
While there are many gear rarities, most players including free-to-play (F2P) will quickly graduate to Purple and Orange (Mythic) gear.
There are three methods to improving hero gear power:

You increase your gear stats through consumption of experience (XP) items or lesser gear as fodder. It is pretty straightforward, and there is little risk since you can reclaim 100% of the XP used (up until red gear below), allowing you to experiment freely.

Once you have orange (mythic) gear and have reached town center level 20, you can increase gear stats through mastery forging. This consumes rare forgehammers at increasing cost, and each additional mastery level provides a multiplicative increase to your gear stats, inclusive of enhancement stats.
Unlike Enhancement, Mastery Forging is not risk-free. If you reset your mastery level, there is a 50% penalty on the returned forgehammers. So you must plan your Forgehammer use carefully.

Late-game progression that unlocks ascended ("red") gear. This requires significant resources and high prerequisites. To ascend a single piece of gear, you must have enhancement level 100 and mastery level 10. You then consume two additional pieces of mythic gear as fodder.
Massive bonuses exist at imbuement milestones every 20 levels. These levels require additional mythic gear, a super rare resource called mithril, and further mastery level enhancement.
**Important:** When a piece of gear has been ascended, it can no longer be reforged to get back either forgehammers or experience. This raises the stakes on making the right choices.

Once you start working with the orange mythic gear and reach level 20 town center, you can begin to use forgehammers to do mastery forging. This is a separate levelling system for mythic gear and provides a multiplicative bonus to the gear stats based on the mastery level.

One of your early game goals should be to outfit your 3 main heroes with mythic gear to advance your progression. If you are a spender and it is important to be competitive in arena mode, you can do mythic gear for your top 5, but the biggest return on your account progression will come from improving your top 3 heroes in expedition mode.

The most reliable way to get this mythic gear as a free-to-play player, especially if you are unlucky with gear chests, is to purchase it every week with arena tokens. Eventually you can get mithril from there as well as Mystic Trials rewards.
The mechanics are simple, the art of upgrading is the real challenge.

There are many guides that do a decent job of giving directional guidance of how to progress through investing resources into hero gear. The conventional wisdom across all of these guides goes something like the following:

**Build one set of each type of hero gear:** infantry, archer, and cavalry. You will transfer this to your strongest heroes as you build new generations of heroes. Do not over-invest in gear that will not go on your three main heroes since there are very few ways the game rewards you for this.

**Prioritize improving the gear with stats that will have the most value** based on the best understanding of combat mechanics. The exact prioritization order may slightly shift from guide to guide, but usually it is something like: infantry health at the top, followed by archer lethality, cavalry lethality, infantry lethality, archer health, and finally cavalry health.

**Follow a step-by-step order** in which you are supposed to increase the gear. For example, bring high priority pieces to a level 80 or 100 and mastery level 6 to 10 before working on lower priority pieces... but also don't neglect those lower priority ones entirely, so put a little experience in them.
**For red gear, follow certain pre-prescribed paths** to hit the imbuement buffs in an ideal order that rewards the right stats first given how challenging the investment is at that level.
While helpful guidance, there are two main blindspots with this approach:
**Evolving understanding of combat mechanics** and changing meta has changed the relative importance of specific stats
**Conventional wisdom relies on heuristics** - simplified shortcuts that do a "good enough" job of trying to express something which is far more complex
All of this can be solved by building a large enough optimization algorithm that takes into account all of these variables and does the math. This is where the Kingshot Optimizer comes in.
In order to actually optimize these investment choices to last-mile (or last-kilometer!) accuracy, you would need a system that does a ridiculous amount of math that takes into account:
All benefits of each stat type for each troop from each type of gear
Numeric assumptions about the relative value of each stat type to each other
An understanding of the entire spectrum of costs for each piece compared to the resources you can invest
**Fortunately, we have programmed all of this into the Kingshot Optimizer for you!**
[**How It Works**](/hero-gear/how-it-works) - Learn the details of the optimization algorithm
[**Start Optimizing**](/hero-gear) - Jump right in and get recommendations for your gear

This optimizer is in active development. While fully functional, we're continuously improving based on user feedback and testing. Please [report any issues](https://tally.so/r/w56bMZ) or share suggestions! <!-- /callout -->
When you run the optimizer, you'll see two improvement percentages:

Not all stats are created equal. To properly assess how stat investment will impact your gameplay, we assign weights to describe the relative impact of each stat. These weights are customized to different build priorities. For example, with a "Balance" build:
Health on Infantry is weighted **1.2x** (20% more valuable)
Health on Cavalry/Archery is weighted **0.8x** (20% less valuable)
Archery and Cavalry have opposite weights when compared with Infantry
This score shows how much **stronger your army gets based on what matters for your playstyle and beliefs about game balance and meta**.
This treats all stats equally (all weights = 1.0). It shows the pure stat increase without considering your priorities.
This number is useful for comparing raw power, but the main improvement score is what actually matters for your gameplay.
<!-- formula --> **Formula:** `stat x (1 + 0.1 x mastery) x weight`
The main improvement uses your build's weights, raw stat gain uses weight = 1.0 for all stats <!-- /formula --> <!-- /section -->
The **The Optimizer** is the most powerful feature - it optimizes **all resources together** (XP, Forgehammers, Mithril, and Mythic Gear) to find the absolute best allocation.
`Final Stat = (Base + XP Enhancement) x (1 + 0.1 x Mastery)`
Optimization maximizes this **entire product**, not just one factor at a time.
**Which pieces will get hammers** when allocating XP
**Which pieces will get XP** when allocating hammers
**Which red gear to ascend** using Mithril and Mythic Gear
How to maximize the **multiplicative effect** between all resources

Sequential approaches (XP first, then hammers) can get "stuck" in locally good but globally suboptimal solutions. The optimizer looks ahead multiple upgrades to ensure resources are deployed for high-impact milestone upgrades (e.g., red gear imbuement levels at 120, 160, 200).
E108 -> E120 (12-level jump to capture +20% bonus)
E100 -> E160 (60-level jump, skips E120/E140 if E160 is better value)
E119 -> E120 (1-level completion to unlock milestone)
The optimizer jumps directly to milestone levels rather than spreading XP incrementally:
This focuses resources on high-impact upgrades. You won't see incremental spreading like E105->E106->E107 within milestone ranges. <!-- /highlight --> <!-- /section -->
Using test data: 400 Forgehammers, 171,930 Total XP (161,930 in gear + 10,000 in bag)

**The Optimizer is +1.6% better!** This might seem small, but it represents finding the **true optimal allocation** rather than a good approximation. Over time and with more resources, this advantage grows. <!-- /section -->
The XP optimizer uses a **greedy algorithm**. It always picks the upgrade that gives the most weighted value per XP spent.
**Calculate Value-Per-XP:** `Value per XP = (Stat Gain x Weight x Mastery Mult) / XP Cost`
**Pick Best Upgrade:** Choose the piece with highest value-per-XP
**Mastery multiplies value:** XP on high-mastery pieces is more valuable
**Diminishing returns:** Higher levels cost more XP for less stat gain
Each mastery level provides a 10% bonus to the total stat gain provided by the enhancement level. This makes mastery extremely powerful for high-enhancement pieces!
`Final Stat = Enhanced Stat x (1.0 + 0.1 x Mastery)`
**Calculate Value-Per-Hammer:** `Stat Gain = Enhanced Stat x 0.1`, `Value = Stat Gain x Weight`
**Prioritize High-Enhancement:** Mastery is a multiplier. Most valuable on pieces with high base stats
**Consider Weight x Enhanced Stat:** Example: Infantry Health at 1000 stat (weight 1.2x) beats Cavalry Lethality at 1500 stat (weight 0.8x)
**Enhance first, mastery second:** Make the base large before multiplying
**Target 60+ enhancement:** Don't push mastery high on low-level pieces
**Weights still matter:** High-weight pieces get priority even at lower enhancement
`Final Stat = Enhanced Stat x Mastery Multiplier`
**Note:** Exact stat values vary by gear piece and are truncated to two decimal places. See **Cost Tables** tab for complete data.
The "Stat Gain" column in your optimization results shows the raw stat points you'll gain from an upgrade.
**Example: Infantry Gloves (Mythic, Health)** Base = 10%, Max = 200%, Weight = 1.2
**Stat Gain = 178.9 - 80.4 = +98.5** (raw stat points shown in results table)
**Weighted Gain = 98.5 x 1.2 = +118.2** (Stat Gain x weight = value used for optimization decisions)
**Higher weight = more valuable:** A piece with weight 1.2 (e.g., Infantry Health) gets 20% more priority
**Lower weight = less valuable:** A piece with weight 0.8 (e.g., Cavalry Lethality in Balance build) gets 20% less priority
The optimizer always picks upgrades with the highest **Weighted Gain per resource spent**
Returns 100% of invested XP to your bag
**Masteries are NOT reset** (keep all hammer investment)
Use this to redistribute XP optimally
**Enhancement levels are NOT reset** (XP investment is preserved)
**50% loss makes it extremely expensive** - rarely economical
The 50% forgehammer loss penalty is too high for most players
Even "wrong" mastery investments are usually better kept than reforged
**Recommendation:** If you've invested sub-optimally, simply follow the optimizer's recommendations going forward rather than taking the 50% loss
<!-- callout:warning --> **Why This Optimizer Doesn't Support Mastery Reforging:** <!-- /callout -->

For complete XP cost formulas, Forgehammer costs, stat bonus tables, and Red Gear imbuement costs, see the **Cost Tables** tab. All data is validated against multiple community sources and calculators. <!-- /section -->
Red Gear (levels 101-200) introduces complex multi-step upgrade paths with four different resources. Here's how the optimizer handles them.
E101 = 50% stat bonus (same as Mythic E100)
E200 = 100% stat bonus (DOUBLE the E100 value)
Red gear (E101-E200) uses a different stat formula than Mythic (E0-E100):
This exponential scaling makes high red gear extremely powerful. See Cost Tables tab for complete stat progression. <!-- /highlight -->
Red Gear Strategy: Progressive vs Conservative
The optimizer offers two strategies for Red Gear enhancement. Select your preferred strategy in the Red Gear Strategy toggle.
Allows incremental Red Gear upgrades up to "pre-conquest" caps: **E139** and **E179**.
Stops just before Conquest milestones (E140, E180)
Allows gradual stat gain without "wasting" resources on Conquest bonuses
Best for players who want steady progress while saving for Expedition milestones
Only recommends Red Gear jumps to **Expedition milestones**: E120, E160, E200.
Focuses on big milestone jumps for maximum imbuement value
Best for players who want to minimize locked XP until they can reach next milestone
Example path: E101 -> E120 -> E160 -> E200

**Why Progressive is the default:** Most players benefit from steady stat progression rather than waiting for large milestone jumps. The pre-conquest caps (139, 179) avoid spending resources on Conquest-only bonuses while still allowing meaningful upgrades. <!-- /section -->
**What it does:** Converts Mythic gear at level 100 to Red quality, unlocking levels 101-200 and imbuement bonuses.
Once XP is added to Red Gear (level 101+), it **CANNOT be reforged**. That XP is permanently locked to that piece. Choose wisely which pieces to ascend! <!-- /callout -->
**What they are:** Red Gear provides percentage bonuses to troop stats at specific milestone levels.
These provide bonuses only in Conquest mode (hero-focused PvP), not troop bonuses for Expeditions.
**Pushes toward 120, 160, 200** - Expedition bonuses provide high value
**NEVER recommends E140 or E180** - These only provide Conquest bonuses (hero health), zero value for Expeditions
**Common pattern: E139 -> E160** - Skips E140 entirely, saving 20 mithril + 5 mythics
Exception: If you manually set gear to E140, optimizer may push to E160 from there. But it will never recommend going FROM E139 TO E140.

Low-weight pieces often stay at Mythic 100 instead of ascending to Red. Why? Because XP in Mythic gear can still be reforged later! These pieces act as "XP banks" - you can recover that XP when you need it. Once ascended to Red 101+, that XP is locked forever.
Reforge low-weight pieces (e.g., Cavalry at E60, weight 0.8)
Use recovered XP to push high-weight pieces to red milestones (e.g., Infantry E100->E160, weight 1.2)
With allowReforge enabled, the optimizer may actively reforge low-value pieces to fund high-value red gear pushes:
Example: Losing 5 stat points on Cavalry to gain 15 stat points on Infantry = net positive with weights applied.
Scenario 3: Mastery Gating (Must Master to Enhance)
**The constraint:** Red Gear enhancement is gated by mastery level. You cannot enhance beyond certain levels without sufficient mastery.

**Why This Matters:** The optimizer enforces this constraint automatically. If a piece needs to reach level 160 (for Expedition bonus), it will calculate that mastery 13 is required and include that in the upgrade path.
Scenario 4: Combined Upgrades (Breaking Through Mastery Gates)

Your piece is at level 130, Mastery 11. You want to reach milestone 160 (+60) for the Expedition bonus. But you can't level to 160 without Mastery 13 first! And mastery looks "inefficient" because the piece isn't high enough yet. <!-- /callout -->
All resources calculated together (XP + Hammers + Mithril + Mythics)
Total value vs. total cost determines if upgrade happens
The optimizer evaluates the **combined path** as a single upgrade:
This breaks through mastery gates efficiently without getting stuck in local optima. <!-- /section -->
How the Optimizer Compares Different Resources
The optimizer uses **percentage-based normalization** to fairly compare upgrades that cost different resource types:
`Value per % of Budget = Value Gain / (Resources Used / Resources Available x 100)`
**Example: You have 200k XP and 50 Mythic Gears**
The mythic upgrade is better value because you have plenty of mythics (50), so spending one is only 2% of your budget!
**Adapts to YOUR resources** - F2P with 5 mythics vs whale with 200 mythics handled differently
**No arbitrary weights** - Based entirely on what you have available
**Intuitive** - "How much of my budget am I spending for this gain?"
**Prevents waste** - Won't burn scarce resources on low-value upgrades
The optimizer applies a **10x cost penalty** to resources that cannot be recovered. This prevents wasteful spending on low-value locked upgrades.
XP in Epic/Mythic gear (levels 0-100) - free daily reforge
XP in Red gear (levels 101-200) - locked forever after ascension

**Why this matters:** When a resource is 10x more "expensive" in the optimizer's calculations, it won't recommend spending it unless the value gain is very high. This prevents regrettable decisions like ascending low-weight pieces to Red. <!-- /section -->
When multiple pieces have identical efficiency, the optimizer uses fair tiebreakers to ensure consistent, predictable recommendations:
If equal efficiency -> piece with higher imbuement bonus value wins (considers weights)
If imbuement values also equal -> uses piece position

Example: Infantry Gloves (weight 1.2, +20% Infantry Attack) vs Cavalry Armet (weight 0.8, +20% Cavalry Attack) at equal efficiency -> Infantry wins because imbuement bonus x 1.2 weight > Cavalry bonus x 0.8 weight
If equal -> uses piece position (Infantry->Cavalry->Archery, Health->Lethality)
This ensures Infantry Gloves is upgraded before Infantry Helm when both have equal value, without arbitrary alphabetical bias. <!-- /section -->
The imbuementConversionFactor controls how the optimizer values expedition bonuses (+20% Attack/Defense at milestones):
Most players should use default (1.0). Higher values make sense if you prioritize Expedition performance over Conquest/Arena. <!-- /section -->
The optimization results table can be sorted in three different ways:
**Weighted Gain (Default)** Shows upgrades ordered by total weighted stat improvement. Best for seeing which upgrades give you the most overall power for your build profile.

**Efficiency** Shows upgrades ordered by value per resource spent. Best for players who want to maximize their gains from limited resources. This sorts by weighted gain divided by normalized resource cost (XP, hammers, mithril, and mythic gear are all factored in).

**Execution Order** Shows upgrades in the order they should be executed. For reforge scenarios, this ensures you reforge XP from low-value pieces before using that XP on high-value upgrades. Best when you're ready to apply changes and want step-by-step guidance.
Toggle between two display modes for stat gains:
**Relative (+%)** Shows stat changes as percentages relative to your current totals. Useful for understanding the proportional impact of each upgrade.
**Absolute (+pts)** Shows raw stat point gains. Useful when comparing specific gear pieces or calculating exact improvements. <!-- /section -->
Have multiple accounts or farm characters
Want to save different gear states for comparison
Need to quickly switch between configurations
You can save your current gear configuration as a named preset for quick access later. This is especially useful if you:
All 12 gear pieces with quality, enhancement level, and mastery
Resource inventory (XP, Forgehammers, Mithril, Mythic Gear)
Presets are stored locally in your browser (localStorage)
They persist across browser sessions and site updates
Clear your browser cache or browsing data
Switch to a different device or browser
Your saved presets will be lost if you:
**Recommendation:** If you have important presets, consider taking a screenshot or noting down your gear levels as a backup.
After running optimization, you can apply the suggested changes directly to your gear input:
**Apply All:** Updates all gear pieces with the optimized values in one click
**Apply Individual:** Click the apply button next to any upgrade in the results table to apply just that change
After applying, run the optimizer again to see what's next for continued improvement. <!-- /section -->
Planning your free Enhancement reforge + resource spending
Finding the absolute best allocation across all resources (including spent ones)
When you have multiple resource types to allocate (XP, hammers, Mithril, Mythic Gear)
Understanding how each resource type works in a vacuum
Educational purposes and learning the mechanics
Already reforged and just got new hammers
Incremental daily upgrades (Next Best XP): Understanding if you can get a better return for the same investment by using the reforge feature
<!-- intro --> Build profiles determine how the optimizer prioritizes different stats when recommending upgrades. Each profile assigns a **weight** to Health and Lethality for each troop type.
**Higher weight = higher priority.** A stat with weight 1.5 is prioritized 50% more than a stat with weight 1.0. <!-- /intro -->

<!-- formation-context --> **Formation Context:** These profiles are designed for the common 50:20:30 (Infantry:Cavalry:Archery) expedition formation. Infantry serves as the frontline tank, Archery provides primary DPS, and Cavalry acts as flankers. <!-- /formation-context -->
<!-- profile:growth --> *Recommended for most players - PvE progression focus*
**Best for:** Vikings, Bear Hunt, Mystic Trial, and general expedition progression.

**Philosophy:** Prioritizes Infantry survivability (tanking PvE content) and Archery damage output (primary DPS). Cavalry receives minimal investment as they provide poor returns in early PvE content. <!-- /profile -->
**Best for:** Early game PvP with standard 50/20/30 formation.

**Philosophy:** Maintains strong Infantry tank while investing more in Cavalry offense for their flanking role. Archery Health is slightly lower due to backline positioning protection. <!-- /profile -->
<!-- profile:gen4 --> *Late-game optimization with Alcar hero skills*
**Best for:** Gen 4+ players where Alcar hero skills unlock Infantry offensive potential.

**Philosophy:** Infantry Lethality increases to 1.1 because Alcar skills enable meaningful Infantry damage contribution. Balanced lethality across all troop types reflects the more flexible late-game meta where 60/40/0 formations become viable. <!-- /profile -->
<!-- profile:unweighted --> *Equal weights for all stats - no assumptions*
**Best for:** Players who want unbiased optimization or are unsure about the current meta.
**Philosophy:** Treats all stats equally. Useful for theorycrafting, testing optimizer behavior, or when you expect major game balance changes. <!-- /profile -->
**Best for:** Experienced players with specific strategies or formation compositions.
**How to use:** Select "Custom" in the Sensitivity Analysis Weight Tuning tab. Adjust individual stat weights using the sliders to match your playstyle and formation. <!-- /profile -->
When the optimizer evaluates upgrade options, it calculates a **weighted value** for each potential upgrade:
The optimizer then recommends upgrades that provide the highest weighted value per resource spent.
An upgrade offers +100 Infantry Health or +100 Archery Lethality.
With Early Game Growth profile: Infantry Health value = 100 x 1.5 = **150**
With Early Game Growth profile: Archery Lethality value = 100 x 1.4 = **140**
Result: The optimizer would prioritize Infantry Health
We're constantly working to improve the Kingshot Gear Optimizer. Here's a preview of features currently in development.

The current Sensitivity Analysis shows how individual stat weights affect your optimization results. We've developed an advanced version using **Monte Carlo simulation** that provides deeper insights.
**Recommendation Stability:** How often the same upgrade recommendations appear across hundreds of simulations with varied weights
**Critical Weight Thresholds:** Points where small weight changes dramatically shift recommendations
**Confidence Scores:** How confident you can be in each upgrade recommendation
**Weight Sensitivity Heatmap:** Visual representation of which weight combinations matter most

<!-- callout:premium --> **Interested in this feature?** Running 500+ simulations requires significant server resources. We're exploring offering this as a **premium feature** to cover infrastructure costs. Let us know if you'd be interested in a paid version of this advanced analysis! <!-- /callout -->
**Status:** Fully developed, exploring premium feature options <!-- /feature-card -->
Manually entering all 12 gear pieces takes time. We're developing a feature that lets you **upload a screenshot** of your gear screen and automatically extract all gear stats.
Take a screenshot of your gear in Kingshot
Upload the image to the optimizer
AI-powered OCR extracts enhancement levels, mastery, and quality
Review and confirm the extracted values

A new optimization tool specifically for **Governor Gear and Charms** is in development. While Hero Gear focuses on troop-boosting equipment, Governor Gear and Charms affect your entire account with different mechanics and priorities.
Optimize charm slot allocation across different charm types
Let us know which features you'd find most valuable. Your feedback helps us prioritize development and decide which features to offer as free vs. premium.
One-click to apply optimization recommendations directly to your gear input. Apply all at once or individual upgrades from the results table.

Welcome to the Kingshot Gear Optimizer. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your information when you use our optimization resource.
**Local Storage Only:** Your gear data is stored locally in your browser. We collect and store:
Your gear configuration (hero pieces, enhancement levels, mastery levels)
Your available resources (XP parts, forgehammers, mythic gears, mithril)
Your optimization settings (weight profile, optimization mode, user profile)
Your preferences (dark mode, beta mode, test mode)
**This data never leaves your device** except when sent to our API for optimization calculations.

If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom, or Switzerland, our legal basis for collecting and using your information depends on the data concerned and the context in which we collect it:

**Consent (Article 6(1)(a) GDPR):** We process data through Google Analytics 4, Google Signals, and Google AdSense only after you grant explicit consent via our cookie banner. You may withdraw consent at any time by adjusting your cookie preferences.

**Contractual Necessity (Article 6(1)(b) GDPR):** We process your gear configuration data via our API to provide the optimization service you requested. This processing is necessary to deliver the core functionality of the tool.

**Legitimate Interest (Article 6(1)(f) GDPR):** We may log anonymized request metadata (timestamps, response times) for service monitoring and security purposes. You have the right to object to this processing.
We use **Google Analytics 4** with **Google Signals** enabled to understand how our optimizer is used and improve the user experience.
When you consent to analytics cookies and are signed into a Google account with Ads Personalization enabled, Google Signals may collect:
Interest categories based on browsing activity

This data is used for aggregate reporting only and is not used to individually target you on our site. You can disable Ads Personalization in your [Google Account settings](https://www.google.com/settings/ads).
**What we do NOT collect via analytics:**
Your gear configurations or resource amounts
Any data you enter into the optimizer
Decline analytics cookies in our consent banner
We display advertisements on our website using **Google AdSense**.

Third-party vendors, including Google, use cookies to serve ads based on a user's prior visits to our website or other websites. Google's use of advertising cookies enables it and its partners to serve ads to you based on your visit to our site and/or other sites on the Internet.
Pages visited and time spent on site
Cross-site browsing activity for interest-based targeting
Your gear configurations or optimization results
Any data you enter into the optimizer
For more information about how Google uses data from partner sites, visit: [Google's Partner Sites Policy](https://policies.google.com/technologies/partner-sites)
When you run an optimization, your gear data is sent to our backend API (hosted on Cloudflare Workers) to perform calculations. The API:
Receives your gear data and settings
**Does not store or log your personal gear data**
May log anonymized request metadata (timestamp, response time) for service monitoring
We use the following third-party services:
**Cloudflare Workers:** Hosts the backend API for optimization calculations
**Google Analytics:** Website analytics and usage tracking
**Google AdSense:** Ad serving platform (when ads are enabled)
These services may collect standard web analytics (IP address, browser type, etc.) as per their own privacy policies.
**Local Storage:** Data persists in your browser until you clear browser data or uninstall
**API Requests:** Your gear data is only kept in memory during calculation and immediately discarded
**Analytics Data:** Google Analytics retains data according to their standard retention policy (14 months by default)
**No Account System:** We don't create accounts or store user profiles on our servers
This site uses cookies for the following purposes:
**Strictly Necessary:** None. Our core functionality uses localStorage, not cookies.
Various Google AdSense cookies for ad personalization, frequency capping, and measuring ad effectiveness
Non-essential cookies (analytics and advertising) are only set after you grant consent via our cookie banner.
Your gear data and preferences are stored in browser localStorage, not cookies. You can manage cookie preferences at any time through our consent banner or your browser settings.
**Access:** Your gear data is visible in the optimizer at all times
**Delete:** Clear your browser's localStorage or use our "Clear Data" feature
**Export:** Use the export features to download your data in JSON format
**Opt-out:** Manage cookie preferences through our consent banner
Under the General Data Protection Regulation, you have additional rights:
**Right to Rectification (Art. 16):** Request correction of inaccurate data
**Right to Erasure (Art. 17):** Request deletion of your personal data
**Right to Restriction (Art. 18):** Request limited processing of your data
**Right to Data Portability (Art. 20):** Receive your data in a portable format
**Right to Object (Art. 21):** Object to processing based on legitimate interests
**Right to Withdraw Consent:** Withdraw consent at any time via cookie settings

**Right to Lodge a Complaint:** You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. Find your local authority at: [EDPB Members](https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/about-edpb/members_en)
For UK residents: Contact the [Information Commissioner's Office](https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/)
To exercise any of these rights, contact: [contact@kingshotoptimizer.com](mailto:contact@kingshotoptimizer.com). We will respond within 30 days.
Under the California Consumer Privacy Act and California Privacy Rights Act, you have the following rights:
**Right to Know:** Request what personal information we collect about you
**Right to Delete:** Request deletion of your personal information
**Right to Correct:** Request correction of inaccurate information
**Right to Opt-Out of Sale/Sharing:** See "Do Not Sell or Share" section below
**Right to Non-Discrimination:** We will not discriminate against you for exercising these rights
Identifiers (device ID, IP address, cookie identifiers)
Geolocation data (approximate location from IP address)
Inferences (demographic profiles from Google Signals, if consented)
Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information

We do not sell personal information for monetary consideration. However, under California law, allowing Google AdSense to collect data for cross-context behavioral advertising may constitute "sharing" of personal information.
Click "Decline" or manage preferences in our cookie consent banner
Enable Global Privacy Control (GPC) in your browser - we honor GPC signals as a valid opt-out request
When you opt out, we serve only non-personalized advertisements.
We recognize and honor the Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal as a valid opt-out request. Learn more at: [globalprivacycontrol.org](https://globalprivacycontrol.org/)
Google Signals and Google AdSense may use automated processing to create demographic and interest-based profiles. This profiling:

May influence which advertisements you see
Does not produce legal effects or similarly significant effects on you
You can opt out of this profiling by:

Disabling Ads Personalization in your Google Account
Using the opt-out links provided in this policy
This resource is not directed at children under 13. We do not knowingly collect information from children.
We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last Updated" date.
This website is operated by the Optimizer Team.
For data protection inquiries, contact us at the email above.
Your information may be transferred to and processed in the United States by our service providers:
**Google LLC** (United States) - Analytics and advertising services

The EU-U.S. Data Privacy Framework (adequacy decision adopted July 10, 2023)
Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission

For questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at: [contact@kingshotoptimizer.com](mailto:contact@kingshotoptimizer.com)

Follow for updates, tips, and community discussions:
Watch tutorials and guides on how to use the optimizer:

<!-- callout:warning --> **Note:** This is an independent fan project maintained by volunteers. Response times may vary, and we cannot guarantee implementation of all feature requests. We appreciate your patience and understanding. <!-- /callout -->
1. Does the optimizer assume all heroes are equally upgraded? What if my account is skewed toward one hero?
No, and skewed hero progression doesn't invalidate the optimizer. The optimizer is intentionally hero-agnostic because hero gear is portable and heroes themselves depreciate over time.
2. The optimizer lowered my total stats. Isn't that bad?

No. Total stat count is not the goal. The optimizer does not weight all stats equally. Instead, it prioritizes stats with the highest value to your progression/goals as determined by the weights of the build profile you selected. This may intentionally reduce low-impact stats to improve high-impact ones. If something looks wrong after understanding this, sharing your case helps debug edge scenarios.
3. Should I only upgrade gear on my top 3 heroes? What about Arena, Conquest, Mystic Trial?
Typically, ~90% of your return comes from your top 3 heroes. The Optimizer's current scope during this open beta is designed with this in mind.
4. Can the optimizer handle multiple teams or multiple sets of mythic gear?

Not currently. This requires judgment calls like "How valuable is infantry health on team 2 vs team 1?" As of now, there is very limited clear data yet on the return on investment between these choices. Additionally, algorithm complexity rises sharply when introducing this, so it was beyond the scope of our current open beta release.
As a workaround, you can budget a fixed amount of XP for your second (or third!) team and run it separately through the tool.
5. If I am primarily a rally joiner and rarely do my own marches for PvP, is it better to upgrade the gear on my joiner hero?
No. Rally joiner hero gear does not affect rally stats; they contribute their priority expedition ability and nothing else. Only the rally leader's hero gear is factored into combat calculations.
6. Should I reforge all my gear first before using the optimizer?
No. Just toggle "Reforge XP" on. The optimizer will virtually reclaim XP, reallocate it optimally, and tell you only the pieces you need to reforge to reduce unnecessary reforging.
7. Will reforging my gold gear destroy it?

No. Reforging does not put your gear at risk, you always get it back. While Enhancement (XP) reforging also gives you back all experience spent, Mastery Reforging only gives you back 50% of the forgehammers. So there is a risk to mastery reforging, which is why we do not recommend it by default, but your hero gear itself is always returned in either reforging scenario.
8. How do I reset the optimizer if I entered something wrong?
Just correct the inputs and re-optimize. Alternatively, you can clear your browser cache (data is stored client-side only).
9. What does "Early Game" mean? Is it up to Gen 4?

Roughly yes, but it's contextual. For more general guidance, we are considering "Early Game" as pre-Gen 4, but many players should think about transitioning to this build type even during Generation 3. This is because there are diminishing returns to the growth acceleration you get from the early growth profile, and you want to start thinking more about long-term future-proofing your account against changes in combat meta.
Profiles are designed for long-term direction, not frequent switching.
10. What does "Gen 4+ New Normal" actually mean? Should I use it even if I don't plan to build Alcar/Margot?

It's about future-proofing against long-term changes in meta, and Alcar and Margot are just some of the first symptoms of this problem that players will begin to face. They are examples, not requirements.
11. Can you make a profile that focuses on [insert particular game mode]?

We will consider it as we get community feedback. But in principle, the weight profiles are not meant to be swapped so frequently. Rather, they are designed for long-term direction given not all investment can be easily reforged out. If we make too many profiles, it both makes the tool harder to be used/understood and will require more rework by users.
12. Why is e.g. infantry lethality being recommended? Isn't that against the norm?

Recommendations are provided based on a mix of the total return you get for incremental investment and the weights of the selected profile. These profiles are more granular than the one-size-fits-all guides of the past, which is part of the value proposition of the Optimizer.

Additionally, your personalized recommendations take into account your historic over/under-investment in a particular stat as it tries to work with what you have and grow you back into an optimal distribution of stats without wasting resources. So your first time using the tool might show you some initial counter-intuitive things that only make sense when you actually check the math.
13. When should I spend enhancement XP, forgehammers, and mithril?

**Enhancement XP** can be spent just about anytime, except for early game where some Hall of Governor's tasks may reward consumption of purple XP items. However, this goes away by the time you start entering the Kingdom vs Kingdom event cycle.
**Forgehammers and Mithril** should be saved for Kingdom of Power, AKA KvK Prep, (or similar events) since these reward significant points on certain event missions.
14. Does the optimizer account for charms, pets, research, island buffs, or exclusive gear?

Indirectly. These stats are additive, not multiplicative, so hero gear can be reasonably optimized in isolation. However, we do account for the general impact of these investment categories in average player accounts at various levels of game progression when selecting default weight profiles.
If you believe you have an edge case, you can always adjust the profiles to use your custom weights.

In the future, we hope to be able to expand the tool to encompass some of these player investments to give even more precise guidance, but it will require us to build new features and modules in our long-term roadmap before this is viable.
15. Is the tool going to be paywalled later when the beta ends?
No. The intent is to keep the tool free and fund operating costs through voluntary support. You can see how to contribute to our efforts on the [Support Us](/support) page.

There may be certain advanced theorycrafting features that we do need to figure out how to offset costs due to their computational and hosting intensity. But in general, our approach is to keep all the critical information an average player needs to compete in Kingshot as freely available.

While we aim to keep this community resource free, there are operating expenses for web hosting, API calls, and more technobabble we won't bore you with here. We aren't looking to get rich with this labor of love, but we do appreciate your help making sure we at least break even!
If you feel called to support our work, you can do so in the following ways:
If you already spend real money in Kingshot, you can route your spending through our sponsor to invest smarter while supporting our project. Use creator code `"optimizer"`
Turning off your adblocker for our website helps us keep the lights on. <!-- /support-card -->
Show your appreciation with a one-time donation.
Join our sponsor's Discord community and sign up for free weekly giveaways. We use it as our base of operations anyway!

The Kingshot Gear Optimizer is a **free optimization resource** that helps players of Kingshot calculate optimal gear enhancement and mastery strategies. The optimizer:
Provides sensitivity analysis and strategy comparison
All calculations are based on publicly available game data
This service is provided **"AS IS" without any warranties**, express or implied:
We do not guarantee accuracy of calculations or recommendations
Game mechanics may change, making calculations outdated
Results are mathematical approximations, not guarantees of in-game performance
We are not responsible for any in-game decisions you make based on these recommendations
To the fullest extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any damages arising from:
Use or inability to use the service
Loss of in-game resources or progress
Data loss (though all data is stored locally on your device)
Use the service at your own risk
Verify all recommendations before committing in-game resources
Not attempt to reverse-engineer, hack, or abuse the service
Not use the service for any illegal or unauthorized purposes
We make reasonable efforts to keep gear stats, costs, and formulas accurate. However:
Game updates may change mechanics without notice
Some formulas are based on community research and may be approximate
We cannot guarantee real-time accuracy with game patches
Features marked as "Beta" or "Test Mode" are experimental and may:
Change or be removed without notice
We provide this service for free and make no guarantees about:
Continuous availability (the service may go offline)
We reserve the right to discontinue the service at any time.
**Game Content:** All Kingshot game assets, names, and mechanics belong to their respective copyright holders
**Code:** The optimization code is proprietary and protected
**User Data:** You retain all rights to your gear data stored locally
We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.
The site may contain links to third-party resources. We are not responsible for the content, accuracy, or practices of external websites.
These Terms are governed by applicable international laws. Any disputes shall be resolved through good faith discussion.
For questions about these Terms, contact us at: [contact@kingshotoptimizer.com](mailto:contact@kingshotoptimizer.com)

<!-- callout:success --> **Summary:** This is a free fan project with no guarantees. Use at your own risk. Not affiliated with Kingshot. We're not liable for in-game decisions you make based on recommendations. <!-- /callout -->

The **Kingshot Gear Optimizer** is an advanced resource that helps players make optimal gear enhancement decisions in the Kingshot mobile game. Instead of guessing which gear pieces to upgrade, the optimizer calculates the mathematically optimal allocation of your resources (XP, Forgehammers, Mythic Gears, and Mithril) to maximize your army's combat power.
<!-- callout:info --> **Important:** This is an **independent fan project** and is **NOT officially affiliated with Kingshot** or its developers. <!-- /callout -->
Since our December 1st, 2025 release, the optimizer has run over **71,000 optimizations** for players worldwide. See what the community is saying on our [Testimonials](/testimonials) page.

Join us on the [Play Smarter Community Discord](https://bit.ly/KSOptimizer-psc), a large community of like-minded gamers with over **15,000 members** across multiple mobile games and a strong **#kingshot** channel. Over **220 members** have joined from the Optimizer user base since launch. It's a great place to ask questions, discuss your optimization results, suggest new features, and connect with other players.
<!-- feature-grid --> Analyzes all 12 gear pieces simultaneously to find the best resource allocation strategy. Considers XP, Forgehammers, and Red Gear ascension paths.
Tests whether reforging your gear would improve your power. Calculates optimal XP redistribution while preserving mastery levels.
Reveals which weight assumptions matter most. Includes strategy comparison and interactive weight tuning.
Fully models Red Gear ascension, imbuement bonuses, mastery requirements, and resource costs (Mithril, Mythic Gears). <!-- /feature-grid -->
See our [Privacy Policy](/privacy) for details on how we handle your data.
Combat outcomes depend on many factors beyond gear (hero skills, formation, opponent strength, RNG)
Optimization is based on **mathematical approximations**, not actual battle simulations
Weight profiles are educated guesses based on community data and may not perfectly reflect your playstyle
Game mechanics may change with updates, requiring adjustments
**Always verify recommendations** before committing irreversible in-game actions
See the [Release Notes](/release-notes) for full changelog.

<!-- team-bio:sloth --> [Strat Game Sloth](https://www.youtube.com/@StratGameSloth) operates the largest Kingshot-only YouTube channel, helping more than 150,000 players each month optimize their gameplay through a series of video guides. From event breakdowns to tips and tricks to in-depth hero reviews and more, his collective works have been viewed millions of times. He draws from background experience in technology, consulting, and game design to help players unpack the often unexpected ways Kingshot works under the hood. <!-- /team-bio -->

<!-- team-bio:zebrave --> PhD Data Scientist by day, lifelong gamer for over 30 years. Previously lost countless hours to MMORPGs and 200+ hour RPGs, but fatherhood had other plans. Mobile games turned out to be the perfect fit for gaming in five-minute increments between diaper changes. This project marries a love of gaming with two decades of professional number-crunching, because apparently optimizing fictional gear stats is a perfectly normal hobby. You can reach him on Discord in the #kingshot channel in the [PSC community](https://bit.ly/KSOptimizer-psc) under the username "Optimizer a.k.a Zebrave". <!-- /team-bio -->
We welcome bug reports, feature requests, and feedback:
Please note: This is a volunteer project. Response times may vary, and we cannot guarantee implementation of all feature requests.

<!-- callout:highlight --> This optimizer was built by Kingshot players, for Kingshot players. We hope it helps you make smarter gear decisions and climb the leaderboards. Happy optimizing! <!-- /callout -->
